page.title: 07School before second war.
page.content: The school at Martinstown was small, with only 60 children, with 3 teachers Miss Stickland, Miss Bailey and Miss Chapel. Pupils had to know their tables or be severely punished, even Mary Bowring once got the cane!Outings were rare but in hot summer weather pupils took their desks onto the Church Green for outdoor work which must have pleased them and their teachers. The school sometimes did plays to which parents were invited but parties were unknown. During the summer, Mrs Duke from the Manor Farm would hold a hay making party for the children and this was the high spot of the year.Pupils who didn't go to Grammar School stayed on at the village school until they were 14 years old. Mary got a scholarship to Dorchester Green School.
